data.title: Chris Penn, Actor in Films, Is Dead at 40
data.meta_description: Chris Penn, actor and brother of Sean Penn, is found dead in his Santa Monica (Calif) home; photo (M)
data.text:
LOS ANGELES, Jan. 25 - Chris Penn, a younger brother of Sean Penn who played supporting roles in films like "Reservoir Dogs" and "Starsky & Hutch," was found dead on Tuesday in his home in Santa Monica, the authorities said. The police said he was 40 though several celebrity Web sites said he was 43.

Mr. Penn's body was discovered in bed, said Capt. Ed Winter of the Los Angeles County coroner's office. He said the actor's housekeeper had called the authorities. There were no obvious signs of foul play, Lt. Frank Fabrega said.

Mr. Penn's credits included "Rumble Fish," "All the Right Moves," "Footloose," "Rush Hour" and "Corky Romano." He also played Nice Guy Eddie Cabot in the 1992 Quentin Tarantino crime drama "Reservoir Dogs." His father, Leo Penn, who died in 1998, directed television shows. His mother, Eileen Ryan, is an actress whose credits include "I Am Sam," "Magnolia" and "Parenthood." His brother Sean Penn won an Oscar for "Mystic River," and his other brother, Michael Penn, is a musician.

Chris Penn's latest film, "The Darwin Awards," is having its premiere at the Sundance Film Festival.
